intro: Aeschynomene chiapensis, commonly known as Chiapanese aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. It is adapted to grow in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in disturbed soils and along forest edges. Aeschynomene chiapensis is also noted for its potential in ecological restoration due to its nitrogen-fixing ability.
